column20: Keywords

column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees

column13: A new Parental Leave Policy provides additional flexibility and entitlements for employees with young families, with 12 weeks of paid parental leave for primary carers and superannuation contributions for 52 weeks. Secondary carers will receive two weeks of paid parental leave, including superannuation.
column20: Parental Leave Policy, flexibility, young family

column13: A new Family and Domestic Violence Policy aims to support team members experiencing domestic violence, including access to paid leave and professional services to help them navigate their ongoing employment.
column20: Family and Domestic Violence Policy, domestic violence, professional service

column6: Minimum notice periods regarding operational changes
column7: Casual employment plays an important role for team members who value flexibility. Wesfarmers' businesses also benefit from this, for example, when managing seasonal variations in employment with a peak in the Christmas period, in line with the broader retail industry.

column6: Occupation health and safety management system
column8: Occupational Health and Safety (OHS) management systems
column13: All divisions have established Occupational Health and Safety (OHS) management systems. The systems assist divisions in fulfilling their legislative requirements and meeting the requirements of Wesfarmers' self-insurance licences. Resources are available within each division to manage these systems and provide the business with technical safety support and services.
column20: Occupational Health and Safety (OHS) management system, self-insurance licence, technical safety support

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column13: During the year, Wesfarmers completed an external safety review, identifying leading safety and well-being practices. The review validated many of the Group's safety and well-being strategies and identified opportunities to enhance well-being measurement and develop new indicators, which will be introduced in the 2024 financial year.
column20: External safety review, safety, and well-being practice

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column13: Wesfarmers' Kmart continues to invest in hazard reduction initiatives, including store fitting design changes to reduce the risk of customer injuries. Kmart has permanently closed several mezzanine deck gate access points to eliminate the risk of a fall from height. Kmart also trialled a new purpose-built ladder in-store to mitigate falls associated with 'steppers' on-site.
column20: Hazard reduction, store fitting, mezzanine deck gate

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column13: WesCEF's HiPo risk management program continued throughout the year, reinforcing to team members the importance of having critical controls before starting a task. There are more than 70 critical controls across multiple activities that are to be verified by team members before starting a work activity, ranging from ensuring a work permit is in place, gas testing when working in confined places, wearing fall protection harnesses to setting up exclusion zones for dropped objects when working at height.
column20: HiPo risk management, critical control, work permit

column13: Wesfarmers' Bunnings continued to concentrate on identifying risks in the workplace and measures to control these risks through implementing the Life-Threatening Risk program. Bunnings implemented lifesaving controls for forklift and pedestrian interactions across all sites. A new Great Saves program was also launched, encouraging team members to call 'Stop' when they observe work that does not have the appropriate lifesaving controls.
column20: Life-Threatening Risk program, lifesaving control, forklift

column13: Wesfarmers' Officeworks' health and well-being program, Your Best Life, continued during the year, with team members provided with tools, resources and initiatives to improve their health and well-being. It included launching an 'always on' health and well-being app, Converge Life, to all business areas, mental health awareness sessions and the continuation of a Mental Health Oversight Committee.
column20: Your Best Life, well-being program, Converge Life

column13: WesCEF adopted the NewAccess mental health support service developed by Wesfarmers in partnership with Beyond Blue. It is available across the Group as a free and confidential mental health coaching program.
column20: NewAccess, mental health support, Beyond Blue

column13: The Wesfarmers Health Mental Well-being strategy offers a suite of services for team members, including the Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Mental Health Partners network, and NewAccess by Beyond Blue. Each service focuses on the different mental well-being challenges team members may face in their professional or personal lives.
column20: Employee Assistance Program, Mental Well-being strategy, NewAccess

column6: Worker participation, consultation, and communication on occupational health and safety
column13: Over 1,500 team members are invited to participate in an annual team member engagement survey to inform WesCEF what works well for them and where the business needs to take action to continue offering an engaging work environment. The feedback from the annual survey is invaluable in guiding efforts to enhance WesCEF's workplace by prioritising what truly matters to its team members.
column20: Team member engagement survey, engaging work environment, feedback

column6: Worker participation, consultation, and communication on occupational health and safety
column13: Officeworks' Mental Health Oversight Committee was established in 2021. It has expanded to include representation across stores, distribution centres and support offices. It aims to develop strategic mental health and well-being processes, including psychosocial risk assessments and crisis protocols.
column20: Mental Health Oversight Committee, mental health, well-being process

column6: Worker participation, consultation, and communication on occupational health and safety
column13: Wesfarmers' Coregas launched a Safety Refresh event in October 2022 to align with Safe Work Month. This interactive forum allowed team members to engage in safety conversations on the Golden Rules and high-potential events with senior management to reinvigorate their commitment to safe workplace operations.
column20: Safety Refresh, Safe Work Month, Safety Conversation

column6: Worker training on occupational health and safety
column13: A key focus in the 2023 financial year was improving Bunnings' leaders and support teams' capabilities to support team members' mental well-being proactively. Key initiatives included training in safety and well-being for team members to manage and identify psychosocial hazards and launching a new Mental Health for Leaders learning and development course to complement existing leader-focused training options.
column20: Mental Health for Leaders, mental well-being, psychosocial hazard

column6: Worker training on occupational health and safety
column13: Wesfarmers' Workwear Group developed a standardised training program for mobile handling equipment operators and three-person competency sign-off, permanent barriers in the despatch area, and a plan to separate people and mobile handling equipment in the battery charging room.
column20: Mobile handling equipment, competency signoff, standardised training program

column6: Worker training on occupational health and safety
column13: Kmart Group continues to support two BSR HER programs (HER Heath and HER Essentials) in line with its public commitment to gender equality and to provide professional skills, health or education training to at least 100,000 women in the Kmart Group supply chain by December 2025. An assessment of the HER Essentials program has reported that it builds the confidence of women and illiterate workers in using technology, supports the explanation of sensitive topics (e.g. reproductive health) and provides a channel for informal feedback among workers.
column20: BSR HER programs, HER Health, HER Essentials

column13: A new approach to flexible working has been introduced for support office teams and is anchored in Wesfarmers Health's new framework called Moments that Matter. This approach is intended to drive meaningful people experiences and interactions that suit individual teams.
column20: Moments that Matter, flexible working, office team

column13: In April 2023, Bunnings launched BWell, a new counselling and well-being support service. BWell provides Bunnings team members with access to counselling, coaching and well-being support, and a range of well-being tools and resources designed to empower team members to be their best.
column20: BWell, counselling, well-being support service

column13: A focus on hazard reduction was Officeworks' key to improving safety standards and embedding a 'switch on' culture. It included implementing traffic management for external receiving areas in all stores, store health checks to support assurance and compliance, trials of wearable technology, such as a deterrent and mitigation of threatening situations, and psychosocial risk assessments.
column20: Switch on culture, safety standard, hazard reduction

column13: Wesfarmers' Industrial and Safety division delivered mental health first aid training, and more than 90 team members were certified in the 2023 financial year. Monthly Health and Happiness communications and live events are shared throughout the division, providing team members access to resources to promote positive employee well-being.
column20: Health and Happiness communication, mental health first aid training, employee well-being

column13: Wesfarmers' NZ Safety Blackwoods launched a FeelSAFE program in partnership with MATES in Construction to support mental well-being. Over the training course, 100 team members have undertaken general awareness mental health training.
column20: FeelSAFE, MATES in Construction, mental health training

column13: Over the year, the Thrive Well-being program was delivered to Wesfarmers' OneDigital team members. It included eight targeted sessions to enhance team members' health, safety and well-being. Themes included nutrition, mental health, motivation and sleep.
column20: Thrive Well-being program, health, safety

column13: Wesfarmers' Blackwoods and Bullivants continue to drive the Stop Access Move (SAM) initiative to raise awareness of manual handling and slips, trips and falls. It saw positive engagement from team members, and the National Safety Council of Australia nationally recognised the SAM program with the award for Best Communication of a Safety Message 2022. SAM was launched in 2020 following a spike in sprain and strain injuries. A deep dive into this data identified manual handling as the largest contributor, and SAM was then developed. \t
column20: Stop Access Move, awareness, manual handling
